reviews.text:
The bread alone is worth every star. Had the Mama‚Äôs Special (without the mushrooms).
Fabulous sandwich and did I mention the bread?  Get a side of the DELICIOUS potato salad.
Roast beef üòò‚Ä¶
Perfect Sandwich. I had a chicken sandwich that was very delicious.
I have been coming here for years. The sandwiches are always fresh from the bread to the meat to all the delicious fixings.
We loved everything about this place! People included!

Stopped in on my lunch break- I so happy I did. Very cozy spot, the food is perfect- good quality and not overly complicated. That you to the lovely ladies working the counter! I felt like I was at my grandmas house. And don‚Äôt forget to grab a coffee at the bakery down the block- aka the garden :) if I‚Äôm in the area again, I‚Äôll be stopping back!
Excellent sandwiches, very friendly service and small town atmosphere...everything we ordered was great
Lovely store. Lovely people. Stellar food.

A hero from Leo's on the way to the ballpark is my idea of the Long Island pastoral. The Mamas special should be in Smithsonian. The meat was well cut and delicious. The cheese toothsome and creamy.  Roasted peppers and marinated mushrooms for  a little contrast. All on the canvas of a semolina loaf.
Owner is so amazing ‚ù§Ô∏èwe fell in love with this place! Best Mozarella in the world!!!
üíôüß°üíôüß°
Can't say enough about this place. What i wanna say has been said a million times more glorified than I could! Love you Mama!
No prices labeled they overcharged ppl

I flew down from Buffalo just to eat that sandwich.   It was so delicious.  The Italian, with mushrooms and sweet peppers. You go next door to the bakery and sit down to eat.   I got a delicious cappuccino after my sandwich.  It was a true treasure hunt.  I highly recommend it.
Traveled from Syracuse to visit this family run deli. Great sandwich, quick service and awesome atmosphere.
A bit overrated tbh. The cheese was nice and succulent but sandwich was kinda dry. Portions are huge however
Fantastic food. Even better service

FOOD IS AWESOME/GREAT!!!!!!!
FOR PORTUON AND PRICING AWESOME
FOOD TASTY , SELECTION, DIFFERENT OPTIONS DIFFERENTS DAYS
PLENTY OF OTHER ITEMS TO BUY AND TASTE
VERY CLEAN, FRIENDLY ENVIRONMENT , ATMOSPHERE IS GREAT FOR FAMILY, FRIENDS OR A DATE
LOVE THE TRADITION AND RESPECT FOR THE FOOD THEY SERVE , YOU WILL NOT BE DISAPPOINTED , ENJOY!!!!

SO SIMPLE AND COMFY !!!!!!!!! - REMINDS YOU OF THE GOOD OLD TIMES****

After nearly 15 years, I finally made it back to Leo's Latticini (aka Mama‚Äôs), and it was like stepping back in time! The same wonderful ladies are still running this authentic Italian deli, keeping the tradition and charm alive. If you're looking for true Italian food and products, this is *the* place to be.

I ordered the Mama's Special, a perfect combination of Prosciuttini, Salami, and Mozzarella with Mushrooms and Peppers. It was as amazing as I remembered‚Äîpacked with flavor and made with the freshest ingredients. Every bite took me back to why this deli has stood the test of time.

Leo‚Äôs Latticini is not just a deli, it's an institution. Whether you're a regular or it's been years since your last visit, the warmth and authenticity here never change. Highly recommend for anyone craving a taste of Italy!

Traveling through the city and stopped for quick sandwich on way to LGA. Ordered it and ate it on the back number of pickup on the corner. Looked like the owner out front, she nicely smile and said Hi! Next thing we know Adam Richmond shows up they were filming. Just a chance visit heading back to Maine! But nice people and a GREAT Real Italian sandwich.  No doubt I will visit if I am anywhere close again! A+!, even if no Adam!
Classic Italian Deli. Happy I stopped in.  Mozzarella was fantastic.
Wow.  Great hospitality and Italian deli. Great for extended layover at LGA or JFK
Stopped in on the way to a Mets game and don‚Äôt regret it one bit. Food was really amazing!

I saw Irene on a Tik Tok recently making mozzarella & I wanted to try it. She is so friendly & social!! I got a variety of items for a party. The food is fresh & delicious! üòã Friends loved the variety of food! I plan to return soon!
Best Sandwich in Queens!
Great mozzarella, owner is awesome and the girls are nice
Love everything here and the owner is the sweetest
Wow this place is incredible, I have to come back and try everything on the menu

This is very old catering deli. It now operates by a third generation. They are kind caring and great cooks. Everything is prepared on premises fresh daily. Great place to grab a hero. It is also the best athletic Italian catering will ever come across.  Highly recommend trying this place . Real old school experience.

This landmark eatery in Corona has the best sandwiches around especially the Fresh Turkey on Thursdays with mushrooms, fresh mozzarella and tasty gravy. They make a great Italian hero with balsamic vinegar and roasted peppers. Close to Citi field and they also own a bakery with a courtyard to eat all the delicious foods these two places make.
Amazing food.

Okay, so reading all of these reviews, I thought I was getting the best sandwich ever! Sadly, I was let down. No roasted peppers?, no fried eggplant?....c'mon. Sandwich was decent. Wasn't what I expected. In the Bronx, you can't beat the Italian combo sandwiches. And for the price, this place is definitely not worth it.
THE BEST! The only thing better than the food, are sisters Carmela and Irene, and gone but not forgotten Marie! #LGM
Outstanding
Expensive
Such a great experience. Amazing food!! The staff and owner are SO welcoming.
Amazing food ‚Ä¶love everything about this place
I just love, love, love this place!!! Food delicious, people great.
What a sandwich!
Awesome
Epic sandwiches.
Mama's is delicious!!!
Great place
Thursday‚Äôs they have roast pork with fresh mozzarella and gravy. When I tell you it‚Äôs a heavenly experience I‚Äôm not exaggerating.
Always da best! Had the Eggplant Parm hero this time and I'm glad I did! Thanks Mama!
Every time i visit new York city, i have to get my fix, the special with peppers and mushrooms. The potato salad and pasta salad are a must as well.
Staff are Wonderful with Family vibes, one of the only real places left with real Food. And most of all One of the best Hero's around with Great size and Great Tasty Flavor!
Perfection at its best!!!! Love this place!!! You will not be disappointed!!!
As usual. Sandwiches & cookies were great

Got the black and white and tri color cookies from an Italian Restaurant in Longwood Fl (Cafe Paisano) and they are amazing!  Reminded me of the cookies I used to get years ago on Franny Lew in Queens.  Just get them when they are fresh and they are fantastic.
Best Italian hero‚Äôs in Queens. Worth the stop. Be warned that they close early so make sure to check store hours. Excellent outdoor courtyard to eat your lunch.
Great authentic Italian foods, meats and bakery. All homemade and fresh. Mama is very nice hostess.

MOMAS SPECIAL.. the greatest Italian hero in NYC... so great they sell them at Citi Field.
Highly recommended.. bring your appetite.. great Italian Bakery right next door.

What a waste of $10 first of all ladies behind the counter 1 had a mask on and the other one no mask.Then 6 customers no mask 1 customer and myself was masked. Ordered special lunch chicken parmigiana OMG dry as dry they must have made it 8‚Ä¶
There's a reason why they call this sandwich the Mama's special.  Creamy muzz spiced ham and salami.  Be sure to top it with hot cherry peppers and marinated mushrooms. Madonna Mia!!
Just a classic place. Always a great sandwich to be had.  Only thing I miss Momma who passed away. We had many a great talk together.
Excellent sandwhiches with a nice yard you can eat in behind the pastry shop. I wish the prosciutto was the imported parma. The mozzarella was excellent.

What a friendly place! We showed up before a ballgame and were treated to fabulous service and delicious sandwiches. Not only is this an exceptionally good Italian deli and restaurant, it is also a great value. The prices are very‚Ä¶

It was odd seeing this place in an area that was predominantly Hispanic.  But the trip was worth it.  The sandwiches are really good with quality meats.  The sides are also good.  I would recommend it if you are in the neighborhood and looking for a great sandwich.

I rated it 4 out of 5 because prices are kind of high.  But remember you are paying for quality.

A fantastic place.  Was greeted by Irene, one of the members of the family that started the business decades ago.  Had the signature Mama's Special and it was wonderful.  Stopped at the bakery too and picked up some cookies.  Also wonderful!

Great sandwiches, simple and tasty, as they should be. The place is small, BUT you may get your stuff here and take it to the Mama's Backyard, an Italian bakery just 2 stores of distance, it's the same owner. There you may finish your meal with a coffee and a tiramisu!

Great sandwiches, go there on a weekly basis. Employees the nicest most hard-working people. Mama's Bakery under the same owners the best cheesecake I have ever eaten in my whole life their cheesecake on a scale of 1 to 10 10
Old school Italian spot that‚Äôs been a staple since forever. Worth stopping by. Good sandwich. Good price.

A wonderful place. The sandwiches and other items are high quality and always delicious and a visit with the fine people that own and run this place just makes everything better. They no longer have an outpost at CitiField, so you have to venture a few blocks west and visit the store. Well worth the trip!

The best sandwich you can ever buy in your entire life for the best price beautiful beautiful beautiful delicious delicious delicious got to go there. They have two concessions at Citi Field and for 11 or 12 bucks you can get a sandwich that will feed two people instead of spending 30 bucks for one and getting garbage. Go there

I've had hundreds of Italian hero's in my life, this was the best no joke.  The bread was crispy and chewy like fresh Italian bread should be. The cold cuts were filled with flavor. I will probably be making excuses to go to queens for this place. The staff were very friendly as well. But that sandwich was unreal. Super Italian, l&t mayo mustard, oil vinegar, sweet peppers.

Believe me any clowns putting this place down are out of their mind.

Looked at high reviews and expected a good hot meal.  All they had when I went at beginning of lunch was processed turkey breast, fish and spaghetti with seafood sauce.  Honestly, the spaghetti was no better than what you get at a corner‚Ä¶

Great Italian spot left in Corona for all the Italian needs you want. And don‚Äôt forget to stop at Mama‚Äôs pastry shop next for all baked needs they both are owned and operated by the same family. So wherever you are from come from California or the other side of the world just other side of town come by and get what ever you want.

Nothing rivals Leo's for great hero sandwiches and Italian dishes.  There is no better place to have holiday gift baskets made.  They also custom make the best 3-6 ft long sandwiches for our Super Bowl parties, decorated with loving care.  If you have never been here, MAKE THE TRIP.

Leo‚Äôs Latticini - great deli products Italian and American. Friendly service from the women working the deli counter. Fresh mozzarella is excellent, Genoa salami, prosciutto , and soppressata are all good. Sliced thin. Different Italian cheeses, and delicious sandwiches on fresh semolina bread during lunchtime.

Went to Mamas Backyard Cafe and Bakery next door very nice Fresh Italian cookies, napoleon pastries, ciabatta breads, and Italian breads. Beautiful Italian cafe with tables and a patio with a fountain in the warmer weather months. Cappuccino served on glass.

The prices are good.

The owner was on site working with her employees and is very friendly to talk to.

My family used to live in the Corona neighborhood, and occasionally we commute to these stores From Astoria for nostalgia and the excellent Italian products.

Este lugar me encant√≥.  Ya he ido 3 veces, tienen un alta calidad de preparaci√≥n en sus comidas, s√°ndwich y por supuesto su pasteler√≠a. Excelente opci√≥n para desayunar, una rica merienda u comprar almuerzo en su otro local e ir a comer al local m√°s grande, que es donde tiene sillas; esta al lado.

Leo's also commonly referred to as Mama's is a treat in any neighborhood.  There are two stores (the deli and the bakery) but separately and together they pack huge punches.  Their sandwiches are huge, delicious and made to order. The deli‚Ä¶
Irene is one of the best owner of an establishment you can ever meet. The sandwiches are far superior to all other big chain competitors. Must go!

2 words... "mama's special". best sandwich ever made. Been going to Mama's since I was a kid. Now 30yrs old and living in Miami Fl, whenever my family comes to visit, they are required to bring me a couple mama's specials.
Love Mama's from Queens. This Queens staple serves specialized sandwiches as well as home made Italian dishes. A must visit if you want a quick bite at a reasonable price.

Go get yourself a sandwich at Mama's. It will be a sandwich you'll never forget. I've been going to Mama Lattacini for many years and each time is like the first time. Nothing more than the best cooked foods for your sandwiches..

Great sandwich,  very friendly owner.  I can die a happier man now that I ate their food.

The mozzarella melted onto my hero with no mechanical assistance.
Chicken francaise with slice of pancetta on top!

Awesome
